bug.short_desc: Establish a process for running JUnits against a COSMOS build

long_desc.thetext: Assuming 211843 is resolved, which is supposed to fix Build issues, we need to establish a clear link between the Build and the JUnits. Specifically, we need to clearly define how all the JUnits can be run against a build at machine located ANYWHERE.... We also need to clearly define both automated and manual parts of this effort.
We need the ensure that the build process is platform independent.
Please confirm that the build process will be completed wholly on COSMOS servers.
Changing these to i10 because we couldn't contain the work in i9. These are high priority for i10.

The test cases will be automated using the TPTP Automation Framework (ANT client). Had issues with test case execution due to an error (org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems:org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control .InactiveProcessException) in the internal RAC. See the bug report for details: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=222382
Found that as a workaround an external RAC can be started before running the automation framework. Proceeding with same, had issues with html report generation of test execution results. Current plan is to proceed with TPTP 4.4.1 as only 4.5 is having report generation issue.
A wiki has been created to capture test automation details and to determine the test cases that has to be automated and the required dependency and other test environment for the same. http://wiki.eclipse.org/COSMOS/COSMOS_TEST_AUTO
This bug is fixed as we have test automation infrastructure in place, but still some of the testsuites fails and give inconclusive results. Please refer the list of dependant bugs.
